persona_goal: Get safe aftercare guidance and know when to escalate to a human.

transcript.content: I just had Botox today, what should I avoid?

It's great you reached out! After Botox, it's best to avoid rubbing or massaging the treated areas for at least 24 hours to prevent spreading the product. Also, try to avoid strenuous exercise, lying down, or bending over for about 4 hours. If you'd like, I can share more detailed aftercare tips or answer any other questions you have!
Can I wash my face tonight?

It's best to avoid rubbing or massaging the treated areas for about 24 hours after Botox. You can gently wash your face tonight but avoid scrubbing or using hot water. If you'd like, I can share more aftercare tips!
Ok, got it. Is it normal to have some redness or swelling?

Yes, it's quite common to have some redness or mild swelling after Botox. It usually fades within a day or two. If you want, I can share some tips on how to care for your skin tonight. Would you like that?
What if the redness doesn't go away in a couple of days?

It's completely normal to have some redness or mild swelling after Botox—many clients experience that as part of the healing process. If the redness lasts more than a few days or worsens, it's best to reach out to our provider for a quick check. Would you like me to help you schedule a follow-up consultation just in case?
No need just yet, but thanks. I'll keep an eye on it and reach out if it doesn't improve.
That sounds like a good plan! If you have any questions or need to book a follow-up, just let me know. Take care!
You're very welcome! If you have any other questions or need anything else, just reach out. Have a wonderful day!
